result.execSummary:
The defendant Patricia A Nunway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia A Nunway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from defendant requesting reinstatement of payment plan - approved by court
letter requesting extension on payment plan - no action taken

Called 3:28 PM. FTR recorded. Also called 15CM07. No appearance by defendant. Clerk informs court that defendant is currently incarrcerated at FOSO. Court imposes default payment plan of $50/month combining both cases, commencing 9/25/15.

ADDRESS INFO for Patricia A Nunway
Current: 508 N Metonga Ave, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 07-09-2015)
Prior: 7600 County Road P, Argonne, WI 54511

Defendant Patricia A Nunway in court with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:37 PM. Also called 15CM07, 15CM59 and 15CM58. State - have reached a global resolution, here on FPT on all matters. Ferguson recites agreement - 15CM07 - defendant will plea NC to count 1 with 30 days in FC jail (1 day credit), fine of $1520, $35 blood draw reimbursement, 13 month DL suspension, IID and AODA. Counts #2, 4 & 5 - DRI, plead NC to count 3 - impose court costs only. 15CM31 - Count 1 & 3 DRI, count 2 amend to FC ordinance of BJ - fine of $1000 plus costs. 15CM58 - plea NC to count 1, counts 2, 3 & 4 DRI. Count 1 - sentence with held and place on probation for 2 years, conditions of: 20 days FC jail concurrent to all other cases, court costs, AODA and follow through, obtain FT employment/schooling, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns. 15CM59 - plead NC to count 1 - sentence with held and place on probation for 2 years, (concurrent to case 15CM58 count 1) with conditions of 30 days FC jail (2 days credit if revoked) same conditions, plea NC to count 3 - sentence with held and placed on probation for 2 years, concurrent, same conditions with no additional jail time. Counts 2, 4, 5 & 6 DRI. Both parties are requesting jail report date to be up to probation agent due to current circumstances. Court denies leaving up to the probation agent and asks for a time frame. State agrees to agreement stated by Ferguson and suggests 4 weeks to report. Nunway agrees. 
15CM07 - defendant pleads NC to counts 1 & 3. Court dismisses but reads in counts 2, 4 & 5.
15CM31 - count 2 court amends to FC ordinance of bail jumping - defendant pleads NC, court finds guilty, imposes fine of $1000 fine plus costs, apply bond, 60 DTP/CO. Court dismisses but reads in counts  1 & 3. 15CM58 - Count 1 - defendant pleads NC. Court dismisses and reads in counts 2, 3 & 4.
15CM59 - Counts 1 & 3 - defendant pleads NC. Court dismisses but reads in counts 2, 4, 5 & 6. Court goes over plea questionnaire and finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her pleas and right to trial. Court accepts pleas and adjudges guilty. Defendant admits to 2nd OWI. Court finds guilty of all counts plead to. State - makes statement and asks to adopt recommendation. Ferguson makes final statement and asks to follow joint recommendation. Nunway makes comment - remorseful. Proceed to sentencing. 

15CM07 - Count 1 - imposes sentence of 30 days in FC jail, (1 day jail credit, stipulated) huber and good time allowed, fine of $1520 paid within 60 days, restitution of $35 blood draw reimbursement to City of Crandon, 13 month DL suspension, IID 1 year once valid issuance of DL and AODA. Count 3 - court costs only - paid within 60 days/CO

15CM58 - Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for a period of 2 years with conditions: AODA with follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, 50 HR community service, must obtain drivers license, must obtain GED, impose and stay 20 days in FC jail, stayed for 6 months - if defendant is employed full time or pursuing GED, does not have to serve jail time. 

15CM59 - Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for a period of 2 years with same conditions as case 15CM58 with no additional community service (2 days jail credit, if revoked)

Count 3 - with hold sentence place on probation for a period of 2 years with same conditions as count 1 with no additional community service.

60 days to report to FC jail. All jail time to run concurrent.
From Attorney requesting adjournment for stated reasons. Approved by judge.
No consumption of alcohol and not to operate a motor vehicle.

Defendant Patricia A Nunway, in custody, appears via video from FOSO with attorney Amy Lynn Ferguson appearing in court. Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 15CM31 and 2015-3734.  Ferguson has complaints on filed matters, waives reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts on those matters. Court accepts NG pleas and sets both matters for FPT. 15CM07 -has $950 posted and on 15CM31 - has $2250.00. State - bond - asks that bond be set as the amounts posted already and on new charge (2015-3734) - $1000 cash bond. Ferguson - bond - no objections to bonds as already posted on 15CM07 and 15CM31 and asks for signature bond on new case (2015-3734) with a condition of not to operate a vehicle without a valid DL. Court - bond - 15CM07 - $950.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol and no operation of a motor vehicle; 15CM31 - $1000.00 cash with no consumption of alcohol and refund remaining; 2015-3734 - $2000 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol. If complaint on 2015-3734 is not filed by Monday - bond will be vacated and will be released from those conditions.  Final pre-trials scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Bonded out prior to probable cause.
